Fields.DialogueText: Buon giorno, Capitano!
Buon giorno, Vespucci. You’re looking lovely this morning.
I am..? I am! Yes, it is I, Vespucci. I am a duelist of true beauty! ...By the way, Capitano, are you ready for today’s sparring? I have a few new things I wish to try.

Fields.MenuText: Question: what happens if your parry dagger accidentally causes the sword to cut your hand?
Maybe we can resume learning the tango?
I’m determined to have a shooting star grant a wish today.

Fields.DialogueText: Mio Dio, that’s awful!
But should it happen, I’ll quickly render first aid!
... The tango was quite fun, but we should be working to refine your fighting skill and mine!
Hoho... You think you can outdo me that easily, Capitano? I’ll show you a challenge!
Just don’t go getting distracted, now.
Likewise, Capitano! Or, do I look like Venus to y-
*ALARM*
What? Really?!
These Morganas are rather rowdy as of late... Hmph! Interrupt our duel, will they?
Care to waltz around them together, Vespucci?
I thought we were learning the tango..? Gah! N-Nevermind, let us prepare for battle.
With me, Vespucci!
@BATTLE
Writing your pen pal, Vespucci?
Si! Ashigara has so much to say today.

Fields.MenuText: "Hungry Wolf" Ashigara? The cruiser? What’s she writing you about?
Huh. I hadn’t realized hand-written letters between Belles were so popular.

Fields.DialogueText: She spent quite a bit of time with "bushido," among other things.
Oh, si, Capitano! Though my letters are more... wordy than hers.
Call me surprised, Capitano. She writes masterfully, but she does it without detail. Her words are coarse, but she has such eloquence!
A walking contradiction, huh? Well, what are you two writing one another about?
This current conversation between us is about stratagems. Ashigara believes that using your wiles to outwit the opponent is paramount. However, you should never lose your soul.
"First say to yourself what you would be, and then do what you have to do."

Fields.MenuText: That sounds ominous.

Fields.DialogueText: Capitano?
Sorry. I take it she's an interesting writer?
Sorry. A little bit of Epictetus I picked up somewhere - it seemed on point.
Does Ashigara have more philosophy to share?
She talks about body, mind, soul, and... passion of the days. That last part irks me a bit, because...
Is something the matter, Vespucci? You can tell me.
Well, Capitano, it’s almost unbelievable! Here she is, telling me to seize the day, capture what is most important to me, and make it mine! H-has she no subtlety?
Remember what I said about subtlety, Vespucci?
I do... However, the time for games is slowly approaching its end.
Whatever do you mean?
Do not be smart with me, Capitano! We are in control of our own fates... I shall show you my beauty!
"Beauty is not in the face; beauty is a light in the heart."
... Is that Epictetus again?
I'll tell you later. We have company.
How dare..! These Morganas will pay - the only company I wish for right now is yours!
I’d be glad to keep yours, too, Vespucci.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Kuh... Try me! (*SLASH!* *TING!*) Hmph! I’ll show you! (*CLANG!*) A-Ah!
Captaino, you stopped my attack! That’s amazing... You’re improving so much!

Fields.MenuText: I’m lucky to have an exemplary teacher.
If I’ve stopped the shooting star, does that mean I can make my wish?
You sure you're not just taking it easy on me?

Fields.DialogueText: Senza senso! I am Vespucci, I could teach anyone! ...Especially you.
I encourage you to keep dreaming, Capitano... Though I wouldn’t mind you wishing on me.
No, Capitano! I'd be more inclined to show my affection in other ways.
I’m glad you feel that way about me, Vespucci. It makes me feel warm and fuzzy.
Don’t get ahead of yourself, Capitano! That arrogance will be your undoing if you keep that up...
Sss... sss...
S-Soderini! Do not speak of me like that! That’s uncouth!
What did he say?
None of your business! Do you think I’m like Cristoforo!? That I'll bare all my secrets at once and still get praise?!
I'd praise you regardless of the status of your secrets, Vespucci. And I don’t know much about Cristoforo.
I don’t care how much you know about her... I don’t want you or anyone else to look at Cristoforo when I’m right here..!
Believe me, Vespucci, when I say that I’d rather look at you...
Capitano...
*ALARM*
Oh, dammit.
@BATTLE
Ah, Capitano! I-I wasn’t expecting you at this hour, how goes it?
Well enough. But, listen, I don't want to take you away from your reading.
Vespucci? Am I intruding?
... Which for some reason you're hiding your back.
Oh, it's just a letter from Ashigara, Capitano. Nothing to worry about!

Fields.MenuText: Why are you hiding it, then? Is she more "rough" than usual?
... Why are you blushing, Vespucci?
Uh-huh.

Fields.DialogueText: Si... She gave me some advice regarding combat and taking charge. Nothing else!
Ashigara’s letter is quite forward... I simply wasn’t expecting it!
Well, whatever’s in there has got you flushing a deeper crimson than yesterday's gumbo.
It’s quite descriptive... A-Anyway, what brings you to my quarters, Capitano? You’ve been staring at my maps for a while.
Well, Vespucci, I’d like to spend some more time with you. Can you teach me how to make maps?
I’d love to, Capitano! ...Teach you how to make maps, I mean!
This one looks detailed well enough to belong in a cartographer’s museum.
... Is that a heart, Vespucci?
No! That’s an island!
... I don't think Benghazi is an island.
Anyway! With my help, I’ll teach you how to draw stellar maps in no time.
*ALARM*
Well, I’d love to start - but apparently we’ve got some company to deal with.
Oh, these... damn sea witches, ruining my moment!
@BATTLE
The home of the legendary Knights Hospitaller? I won’t let them waltz all over the island as they please! By the stars, Capitano, we should hurry!
We're loading up on food and medicine before we set out. ... But I think we might just have time to slip in one more dance or duel.
As much as I would love to, Capitano... I think we should talk. I believe there’s more to this than meets the eye. I’ve started to notice something about the Morganas.
Vespucci! I’ve come to deliver some news to my tango partner! We’re going to be on the move to Rhodes - apparently they have a pretty significant Morgana problem.

Fields.MenuText: That they’re entirely unreasonable and interrupt my time with you?
They’re being controlled by some unseen puppetmaster?
I knew it! They’re from the Devil’s Triangle! ...I’ve heard San Juan is lovely for dates.

Fields.DialogueText: I strongly agree with that notion, but that’s not what I noticed.
I’m not sure if there’s one "grand puppetmaster." However...
I don’t know of their origin and... Ergh... Capitano! P-Please! Focus!
Tell me, does an adventurer also get to solve mysteries? I feel like solving this one with you.
Si! An adventurer braves the unknown and comes out better for it! ...And, I’d love to go on another one with you.
Ahem! We should depart for Rhodes post haste!
I'm looking forward to it. Your beauty and grace will outclass any Morgana we run into.
Beauty and grace is one thing... Grazie, Capitano. However! At the end of the day, raw skill, intuition, and reading your opponent shall win the day!
*ALARM*
I guess we do have some time to practice our dances.
Capitano... Again, please go slow with the tango. I’m still learning...
With pleasure, Vespucci.
@BATTLE
Hrgh, I’ve almost got it this time...
That’s it. Step 1, twirl, step 2, twirl...
You won’t outdo me, Capitano.
We’ll see about that... Hmph!
Ah! A-aspetta! I’m going to fall over if I-!
Nope, I’ve got you.
Eyah! ...Blast it, I tripped over my feet again. Every other dance we’ve done I’ve done spectacularly! What am I missing from this one?

Fields.MenuText: It takes time, patience, and a bit of love, Vespucci.
There's no rush here. For you, I’d keep dancing until the moon lands on our deck.
It's remotely possible that the problem is on my end.

Fields.DialogueText: No, Capitano! You don't need to protect my feelings - though it's very kind.
I'm not protecting your feelings, Vespucci. You're the most graceful person I know.
Gah!
Ordinarily.
Don't worry. You'll be dancing up a storm in the end.
Dancing is akin to battle then..? Hmph! I’ll learn this whole thing yet!
C-Capitano! We’re training for Rhodes, remember?
I have the utmost confidence in you, Vespucci. Besides, you should enjoy yourself now. The situation at Rhodes is deteriorating...
We leave at dusk, correct? Hm... What I’d give for a night of stargazing...
Sss...
I-I didn’t ask for your input right now, Sodeirni! Please don’t say such things!
Well, now I have to know what he’s saying.
Nothing that you haven’t heard before, I assure you!
*flick tongue*
Either way, we’ll go so fast around Rhodes that those Morganas won’t know what hit them!
As fast as ever, Vespucci. I don’t know how you can be jealous of Cristoforo: you’re amazing.
Do not speak of Cristoforo!
...She is her own woman, and I will show her that I am just as good, if not better than her!
But... grazie, Capitano. Thank you.
*ALARM*
And apparently, it’s the Morganas' as well. May I have this dance, Vespucci?
Pleasure’s mine.
Ce ne vogliono due... Let us be about it, C-Capitano.
@BATTLE
There’s a lot of them... When you said that Rhodes’ situation was worsening, you weren’t kidding! No matter, I’ll slash through them all!
Man, that sea breeze from Karpathos really is something - nice, salty, and with a hint of mint.
... And some Morganas about, too.

Fields.MenuText: "Though she be but little, she is fierce."
Right! We’ll clear them out and then take Rhodes by force.

Fields.DialogueText: That line... Capitano, I take it you’ve seen the new book I’ve gotten?
All of these Morganas... Hmph! "Ill met by moonlight, proud Titania."

Fields.MenuText: I'd be careful about saying things like that. The crew's already joking they can sleep in and leave the fighting to you.

Fields.DialogueText: ... "Lord, what fools these mortals be."
"A Midsummer Night's Dream?" I didn't know you were into acting.
What do you mean? It’s a story!
Well, yeah. But it's a play. It was written to be performed.
And it probably has been, about a thousand times a year, since the late sixteenth century.
Please do not spoil it for me, Capitano! I haven’t finished reading it yet. It’s a rather sweet play...
Would you like to read it together, later? The Morganas are getting restless right now.
Actually, worse than restless. The reports make it sound like they're getting more organized by the day.
Ah, Capitano - do you need wise counsel? You should ask Soderini!
I normally would ask you, but... sure, why not? What does Soderini have in mind? Er, what do you have in mind, Soderini?
(*tongue flick*) (*crawling around Vespucci’s collar*) (*pause*) Sss... SsSsSs...
Capitano, Sodeirni suggests that we first lure them towards the fleet. Once the're assembled, we can use our superior speed to blow right through them!
...That’s actually rather sound. Thank you, Soderini, I think I’ll do just that.
Say, you wouldn’t know how to dance, would you?
*shaking rhythmically*
... Can he understand me?
He’s been able to this whole time! Now come, Capitano, we need to clear this blockade. En garde!
@BATTLE
Porca miseria! It’s a mess! I can feel their spirits close...
It’s like walking into a party you weren’t invited to - with security looking daggers at you.
Entering Rhodes' territorial waters now!
What? Who wouldn’t invite *you* to a party? You’re the most fun person I know!

Fields.MenuText: I’m a bit of a partier, what can I say?
And you're the prettiest.
You may need to get out more.

Fields.DialogueText: You’re a regular... who’s that one in the American book? Gatsby?
I hope not. It didn't end well for him.
A happy Gatsby, then!
Thank you, Capitano - you’re not too bad yourself.
No, no! Don't you dare sell yourself short!
Thank you very much, Vespucci. I wouldn't say I'm a real sybarite - more than anything else I'm a warrior. I guess on my more exciting days you could say I'm an adventurer.
But! You need to remember how to have fun. If you never have fun, you’ll ruin yourself.
But how can we have fun at a time like this? There are Morganas everywhere!
Well, we can spar, we can dance - or we could discuss Shakespeare?
But what about Rhodes, Capitano?
We're here and we're doing the job - but we shouldn't let it overwhelm us to the point where we can't think about anything else. For instance, I’m going to practice mapping this coastline out...
Fresh meat... fresh souls!
Can’t you wait a minute? I’m trying to map out that rock formation. Vespucci, does that look like an umbrella to you?
Capitano! Give me that!!! (*swipe*) You’ve... (*trying to refrain from giggling*) made your point.
Right? It’s okay to be rigorous and forthright sometimes, but allow yourself some... I don't know, leniency.
Leniency. I’ll remember that, Capitano...
Fun... fun... fun...
Do you want to join in? Vespucci and I were dancing earlier...
I think you’ll love it, sea witch. It’s called La Danse Macabre.
@BATTLE
That’s because I’ve been deeper within my mapping, notes, and letters from Ashigara. Did you know that in Japan they sometimes train for ten hours a day?
There’s a lot more paper in here than I remember.

Fields.MenuText: So do we, these days.

Fields.DialogueText: Ah, si? It doesn't feel like it.
Then we're probably doing something right.

Fields.MenuText: That's kind of extreme.
She may be trying to impress you there.

Fields.DialogueText: It's working!
Actually, I'm curious about these letters from Ashigara. How are you finding her as a correspondent?
She’s quite... coarse, putting it lightly. However! She’s still an utter joy to talk to, with good handwriting, and a surprising amount of stoicism.

Fields.MenuText: Does she give you any ideas about what an enterprising Belle might do for fun?
I can see some hearts at the bottom of this letter. Does that mean anything?

Fields.DialogueText: According to Ashigara, she and her crew also partake in sparring, reading, and the like! They also have... um... "ukiyo-e."
Disregard it, Capitano. It’s nothing important! Err, they contain a few highlights from the letter.
And the marks around the bottom of the letter? Points you're highlighting?
Highlights?
O-Oh! Well, if you must know... Ashigara is not only bold, but knows about how to press the advantage, keep your eyes on the prize, and to claim what’s yours!
Keeping goals and slowly achieving each one is a great way to keep yourself sharp! ...Much like your handwriting, actually.
Thank you, Capitano! I’ve been keeping it in tip-top shape with my quill.
Yeah, somehow I figured you’d write with a quill. Is that a dove's feather?
W-why, yes. It is. After all! You must write down your words with passion.
That so? Remind me to get one.
Ah! You’ve been using your teletype, too!
Si, Capitano. I’ve been using it to send letters, battle plans, feedback, lessons, and some new drafts. Oh! The tea is done!
Drafts of what?
*ALARM*
Remind me to ask you later. Trouble’s brewing.
I so hate how they ruin our time together! Had they done it at a time where we weren’t sharing the moment I’d be happy!
... Are you happy with me right now, Vespucci?
Dovresti saperlo... Please, Capitano. Let's get rid of them so we can get back here faster!
Sounds like a plan. Oh, can you put honey in mine? I love what you do with it.
Honey... honey... (*blush*)
@BATTLE
Sorry. Tea on the brain - can I take a cup to go?
Oh. Si, naturalmente!
Ah, welcome back, Capitano! You caught me at a good time, I just finished up a call.

Fields.MenuText: You used the phone!? Ah, Vespucci, I’m so proud of you!
What’s got you in the phone mood? Some juicy secrets?

Fields.DialogueText: Capitano... Thank you so much! I-I’m... give me a moment.
Should I ask what brought this on?
If you must know, I had to know that recipe that cook used for marlin!

Fields.MenuText: Wait. Are we having some kind of crisis?

Fields.DialogueText: Food so good that it demands people learn more? I should’ve gone for seconds!
The marlin was great, but the decision to use the telephone was my own! Now come, take a seat, Capitano. I’ve prepared some tea for us.
Ah. Smell that honey.
Thank you... Vespucci? Why are you blushing? Did you put alcohol in this?
No, Capitano. A-anyway, that marlin was delectable. I just had to call the cook to learn what they did with it!
You don’t eat often, Vespucci. I assume it's down to being a Belle? You're just not hungry?
Si. But... we may not require sustenance, but I feel the need to expand my palate sometimes.
Well, at least you know how it is. Hm! You know what I think you’d like? There’s this special flavor of sorbet that they serve in Sardinia...
I don’t think I’ve ever heard of Sardinia being famous for sorbet.
We should go there sometime. Maybe after this operation is over...
*ALARM*
Huh. I’m starting to see what you’re saying by "ruined moments."
I’m going to cleave them in two! ...Er, Capitano, could you write down the name of that sorbet? Just so that I don’t forget it...
I’ll warn you. If saying the word "honey" is enough to get you to blush, this might get you as red as tomato.
Hmph!
@BATTLE
Capitano! There you are! ...Why do you look so chapfallen?
"Chapfallen?" I thought you were reading "A Midsummer’s Night Dream?"
Anyway, the meteorologists say a heavy rainstorm is coming in...
Squall, storm, or sun, I’ll brave them all, Capitano! You have nothing to worry about as long as I’m here. Consider it a hero’s challenge to brave this and save Rhodes!
We still need to be careful, though. It’s very easy to get lost in storms. A difficult dance indeed.
But I’ve nearly learnt the tango, Capitano! And, besides the point, I have faith in you! I trust you with my sword and soul!

Fields.MenuText: Sword and soul? Have you been reading Ashigara’s letters again?
I'll strive to be worthy of them.
Likewise. You have my heart and soul.

Fields.DialogueText: You already are, Capitano! You already have... I mean...
Buon Dio, Capitano!!! W-Why would you..? ...Thank you.
She sent me over some of the works by famed swordsman, Miyamoto Musashi! A bold man.
There’s no reason to be all shy, Vespucci. It’s just dancing about the enemy.
In some ways, he reminds me of... well...
Si! ...But I’d much rather spend some time dancing with you, Capitano.
Believe me, I would too! But right now I’m focused on one simple thing: to make sure that everyone on in the fleet - and this ship in particular - makes it out alive.
Likewise, my goal is to make sure that we come out on top, and stand by my Capitano. But, we must free Rhodes! If we don't, who knows what will happen!?
Agreed, but battle is a series of movements, improvisations, and passion.
Like a dance... With our bonds, we will pursue bravery, glory, security, passion, and... (*blush*)
Vespucci? Aren’t you going to say...
*BOOM*
Don’t think you’re off the hook: I want to hear you say it later. Tally ho!
@BATTLE
Capitano! There you are - you missed our sparring this morning!
... And our dance practice.

Fields.MenuText: When I saw your beautiful locks out this morning I had to hide away.
Sorry. It's been one of those days.
I was getting caught up on paperwork `til about five this morning. Just came to face-down on my desk half an hour ago.

Fields.DialogueText: ...Grazie, Capitano. I-I’ve been taking better care of my curls.
I understand. I heard some of it.
Yeah, sorry about the cursing.
So next time I should come in and get you?
I’m glad that you’re here on deck to give me some peace of mind. A storm’s rolling in and I could use some downtime.
... Yeah, maybe.
Well, take a seat, Capitano! I would like to discuss something with you.
I’d be all right with it. What about you, Soderini?
(*lick*) (*backflip*) Sss...
He’d love to eavesdrop, but probably won’t have much to say...
Hah! He’s really honest, isn’t he?
Sometimes I wonder if Soderini is capable of even lying...
Me, I wonder if he has a tell. Maybe his scales change when he’s lying?
(*angry noises*) (*crawls up Vespucci’s pith helmet*) SssSSS!!!
Pahahah! “Don’t refer to me in the third person when I’m right here!”
Sorry, Soderini. I’ll keep that in mind for future reference.
Moving on, there’s something I’ve been trying to say lately.
Well, what have you been trying to say? Am I missing something here, or, did you forget to tell me something? ...Have I forgotten to tell you something?
No, no, Capitano! I just want you to know that I appreciate you and all that you do. Taking care of the crew, staying with me, going on adventures, and learning about the world!
Oddio, I didn’t know how to dance before you showed me! So... Thank you, Capitano.

Fields.MenuText: I’d do it all over again just to see you smile, Vespucci.
Love takes two, Vespucci. I’d do it anytime.

Fields.DialogueText: Capitano... (*whispering*) Come puoi essere così dolce...?
C-Capitano! ...You’re right, but, Madonna - have you been reading Ashigara’s letters behind my back!?
I have my ways. Is there anything else you wanted to tell me, Vespucci?
Well, it’s about my sister, Cristoforo.
Is there trouble?
No, no, nothing of the sort. Rather, she and you have both inspired me to try something new.
Have we? What did we inspire you to do?
Capitano, I want to become more approachable. You say I’m rugged, old-fashioned, and wise beyond my years.
Capitano, I want to learn what it’s like to be *me* instead of just the heir to old traditions.
Vespucci, all those qualities you listed make you adorable. That said, I'd be delighted to help you a bit more... on the outside of things. I promise, it’s a lot easier than it looks.
... Capitano, look! We have company!
Again!? Damn it! Battlestations, everyone!
@BATTLE
Capitano! You need to get to the bridge!
I'm not sure I can find it! The mist isn't toxic, but it's... everywhere.
Oh, it's toxic. I'm protecting you as best I can. Take my hand - I'll bring you where you need to be.

Fields.MenuText: Best offer I've gotten all day.
Thank you.
We need to move fast! I can hear the Morganas in the distance!

Fields.DialogueText: Come on!
@BATTLE
The mist is breaking up...
I'm not sure you should be out here, Capitano. All our foes took mortal blows... but I'm not sure they've all realized that they're dead.
All the more reason to have more eyes on deck.
I just-
Capitano?
Vespucci, we need to-
C.. ApiTanNnNoo..! VESPUCCCIIIII!!!

Fields.MenuText: Oh, hell! Vespucci! Get to the bridge - don't let her target your human form!
Can’t get out of the way..!
Okay, in hindsight, maybe I made a bad call coming out here.

Fields.DialogueText: What’s...!? Awah!? When did you get behind us!? Damn sea bitch!
Capitano, no! It’s too dangerous! Get back to your...!
*BOOM*
Ghah...! D-Damn! Vespucci...
Capitano..? Hah... CAPITANOOOOO!!!! Capitano, stay with me, I’ve got you! Hold your breath, count to ten, do anything!
V-Vespucci... I’m sorry...
Why!? Why!? Capitano, please, you can’t expire... You’re our Capitano..! We need you! Don’t go!
Don’t worry... about... me... I... see... you smile...
Capitano..! Please, stay with me! Stay alert! Please, don’t close your eyes, Capitano!
Keep fighting... I want to see you dance... Vespucci... I love...
Signora! The Morgana is sinking - that shot was her... Capitano?
Get the doctor! GET THE DOCTOR NOW!
I’m... awake. Okay. This is... Vespucci’s room?
(*gasp*) Capitano! (*hug*) Are you all right?!
I feel like I’ve been stung by two hundred hornets...
Don’t move! Here, drink some of this.
Hmm... (*sip*) (*sip*) (*coughing*) Damn, it tastes like a tire fire!
It’s supposed to dull your pain, Capitano. Are you feeling okay?

Fields.MenuText: I am now that I'm looking at you.
I have a lovely lady sitting at my bedside and giving me headpats. I’m better than okay.
Never mind me - how are you?

Fields.DialogueText: Capitano... I’m so glad you’re safe. It’s all my fault.
No, I was the one who didn’t account for the Morgana coming at us. And I was the one who tried to get between you and the blast.
(*sniff*) You don't have my senses! One of the Morganas could’ve come up on deck and eaten you! It *is* my fault...
Vespucci, listen to me, you are not to blame.
But I let my guard down! Not even the mighty Spartacus would do something so incredibly brazen! (*hugs the Captain tighter*) ...You could’ve died..!
Ow! OW! Vespucci, please, you’re hurting my wounds...
Mi dispiace, Capitano! ...The doctor has told me you’ll be bedridden for a week at most.
Damn... But, hell, I don't regret trying to protect you. Adventurers together, right?
Capitano, please. I want you to promise me. *Please*. Be more careful, and stick with me... I can’t imagine what would happen if I lost you.

Fields.MenuText: (Hug Vespucci.)
(Kiss Vespucci on the cheek.)

Fields.DialogueText: Ahah!?
Vespucci, I promise. But... I want you to make sure you stay safe too. I know you love to court danger - but I'd feel incredibly lonely dancing the tango without you.
Capitano...
Vespucci...
Capitano, there’s something that I-
*ALARM*
What good timing... Get out there, Vespucci.
Capitano..!? What will we do!? You’re incapacitated!
Doesn’t mean I can’t give orders from bed - this is why we pulled all those strings to get the phone system put in in the first place. Just pass me the horn and get to the bridge.
Capitano... Ah! Si! The fact that you can still have the gumption to call orders when you’re bedridden like this is... amazing to me.
Believe me, it is to me, too. Now, Vespucci, get out there. Fight with bravery, honor, and love! I’ll be watching...
Capitano... I’ll give it my all!
@BATTLE
"Look where thy love comes. Yonder is thy dear..."
*BOOM*
Ah, hell! Guh... Can’t move... Need to reach the... phone!
Capitano! You’re there! Listen, it’s a total mess out here! There are Morgana surrounding us from all sides!
Right. Listen, we need to get Vespucci on the line and-
Right here, Capitano!

Fields.MenuText: Vespucci, what’s going on out there?
Belle powers. Right. That helps.
Can't a captain get some peace and quiet?

Fields.DialogueText: What's going on out there?
There are Morgana about, Capitano! It is as the sailor said, they’ve grown bold!
Your rest is important, Capitano! But these Morganas don’t seem to agree with that...
(*to the Sailor*) Slow to a halt, and prepare to salvo!
Si, Capitano!
Vespucci, it’s time I taught you how to do the waltz. Get back to the bridge, relay what you’re seeing to me by phone-
Si, Capitano! My sword, soul, and passion!
Then put on your good shoes, we’re about to dance the dance of blades!
@BATTLE
It appears they’re a lot more resilient than I once thought... But, that’s what dancing is for. Vespucci, how are you doing out there!?
Haha! These Morgana are no match for me! I’m slipping right by them..!
Capitano! Incoming enemy to port!

Fields.MenuText: Typical. Vespucci, would you mind lending a helping hand?
May I have this dance, Lady Vespucci?

Fields.DialogueText: Si, Capitano! I’m on it!
You may... It takes two to tango!
Or just appear here?
Or just appear back here for a second or two, if the bouncing back and forth isn't too distracting, and I’ll guide you. We’re in this together, even though I’m in bed.
Pretend I’m right with you, Vespucci. Remember! One step, twirl, two step, twirl, three step, reverse!
I still can’t believe you’re using the phone to contact me! I-It’s like you're there, and yet not..! Ahem! I am the star that shall shock and awe the Morgana! I’m the shining beacon of the ballroom!
And I’ll be there to witness you as stardust coats the floor because of your grace!
Together!
*BOOM*
*BOOM*
Damn, that’s a lot of commotion...
Vespucci? Come on, pick up the damn phone...
Capitano? I'm very sorry, Capitano - things here are-
Feel my passionate rhythm! I’ll show you just how much my power blossoms!
Sloppy...
You dare to call me such!? And where is your salute!? Basta! Enough of you!
Jyajyajya...
Things are hectic on the bridge!
Vespucci! Can you hear me?
Si, Capitano!
You’re doing beautifully, Vespucci. Don’t let up. Show them what it’s really about!
Ha! As you say, Capitano!
Ves... pu... cci...
You can save your cries for someone who can stand to hear it!

Fields.MenuText: Ah, hell. It's never a good sign when they start learning names.
If you're not giving her a chance to talk, you're winning!
You’re simply amazing, Vespucci. I can’t wait to rejoin you.

Fields.DialogueText: Capitano?
Never mind! You've got this!
Rest your bones, Capitano! Remember, you’ve only got two days left!
I just feel jealous. I’m missing all of the action, supplies are running low, and...
Of course I'm winning! But don't excite yourself!
Of course I do! But don't excite yourself!
At-tut-tut! None of that right now, Capitano. I don’t want you worrying your fragile head over anything!
Now where did that come from? ...Am I like a porcelain doll to you?
Truth be.. (*TING!*) told... (*CLANG*) I wish to spend some more time with you after this is over.
If you win this, Vespucci, I’ll read "A Midsummer’s Night Dream" with you, beginning to end.
Aaawah!? S-Say no more! Come, all of you! Not one of you will remain after I’m done pirouetting!
@BATTLE
Are there no more Morganas left...?
I wouldn’t say that. Given how things have been going lately I’d say there are a few more. How are you feeling, Vespucci?
Capitano... I must confess: with you around me, I feel as though I’m unstoppable.
The same could be said for me, Vespucci. I feel like I’m traveling through the stars with you right this moment.
...You had best believe I’m holding you to your promise. Reading to me.
Would you rather I use my husky voice for Oberon or Lysander?
B-Both, please...
We haven’t had a proper supply run in weeks... food is running low. And I’m still in bed. Dammit, dammit, dammit.
Capitano! Are you ready to read today?

Fields.MenuText: Vespucci... I’m feeling a bit sick at the moment.
Where did we leave off again? I’m sorry, I’m not in the best mental state.
Vespucci, we have a situation here. We’re running out of supplies.

Fields.DialogueText: Capitano, how can you say such things when you look radiant? You’re almost out of bed!
I know... But I can't ignore the facts in front of me. We’re running out of everything from shells to rations. If the crew eats hardtack, it’ll be mutiny.
Capitano, I’m sure they’ve eaten worse. Please, sit up.
Grgh... I’m sorry, Vespucci, I must look like a fool. What kind of Captain lays in bed all day in the middle of a crisis?
... Capitano...
Yes, Vespucci? What’s going—
*SLAP*
Hooh! Damn, you have a strong hand... And, thank you.
You’re welcome, Capitano... In fact, I should be thanking you.
I know things may look grim. But please, I want you to be brave through it and keep smiling. You love seeing my smile... And I love seeing yours.
With your orders I’ve been successfully able to cleave through Morgana like it’s nothing, navigate around Rhodes through a thunderstorm, and learn how to dance like a real noblewoman!
I know you’re fearful, Capitano, and I know you care about the crew, dearly! I know that you care about me! ...I need my partner. Will you please grant me my wish?
Your expression is heavenly... I feel I’ve been awoken from a most pleasant dream by the queen of-
*ALARM*
Dammit.
Are you ready now, Capitano?
Yes, I am. (*getting up*) Ack!
C-Capitano! Don’t strain yourself! Please!
I just need to limber up is all. Soderini inspired me with how he bends his tail.
Ssss... (*flicking tail*)
So, Vespucci, are you ready? We’re about to give the Morgana what they’re looking for!
Si! Con il mio Capitano!
@BATTLE
Vespucci, pirouette! And allow me to do so as well...
Don’t get flustered now, you sea hags!
@BATTLE
Shishi... Vespucci... You won’t escape.
Too slow!
*BOOM*
You know, you serve as a nice distraction, Capitano.
What can I say? I learn from the best.
Capitano! The Morgana have been dispersed! Lookouts and instruments both say we're clear.
Thank you for the dance, fair lady.
C-Capitano... You’re too close...

Fields.MenuText: I can see your ruby eyes better this way.
You’re so cute when you’re like this, Vespucci.
You're standing on my foot.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh!
C-Capitano... We’ve done it...
A lovely dance it was, and-
*HUG*
MPHH!
Words cannot express how proud of you I am, Capitano.
I could say the same, Vespucci... You make my heart sing.
Do I really? Grazie, Capitano...
Listen, our little stunts back there have given me an idea. Maybe even the beginning of a plan.
A plan, Capitano? What?
First some observations - these Morgana groups are strong inside the storm, though they seem to struggle with complex movements. And they become considerably more disorganized when out of the rain.
Hmm...
One other observation: dances always have leaders.
Perhaps there’s an eye in the storm, Capitano? ...No, wait!  They have a flagship! They must have one!
That’s what I’m thinking. If we can take it out, we can disorient them - maybe make them lose group cohesion. They’re following us hard right now.
Si, because more of them are coming from the stern... What do you suppose we do?
That’s where you come in, Vespucci. I need you to use your excellent navigation skills to take us through the rocks ahead. It’s dangerous and a bit stupid.
But if these Morganas aren't totally feral - if someone's got them acting like a proper fleet - they’ll lose some speed trying to keep up with us in an obstacle course.
And if they *are* feral and just crazily chase after us... well, the rocks won't be kind.
Capitano... That’s brilliant! Though there may be a storm about, I know the island of Rhodes! I shall guide us through the rocks ahead with no trouble.
Excellent. I'm looking forward to seeing how you sashay through the rocks.
C-Capitano, please quit being lascivious! It’s improper and imprudent!
Do you dislike it?
N-Not when you say it... Ergh... Shall we depart?
Let’s give them a little show, shall we?
I will admit, Capitano, I wasn’t too keen about dancing before this exhibition. And now I’m afraid it’s become a habit.

Fields.MenuText: Habit nothing. You’re a natural, Vespucci.
I could watch you slide through these rocks for days.
Just be careful, okay? I know dancing through the rocks was my idea, but I don't want you hurt.

Fields.DialogueText: I rather enjoy it... Maybe in a previous construct I was a ballerina?
... Am I really that beautiful to you? Grazie, Capitano!
With you with me, Capitano, I can feel no pain.
I'm serious. It would break my heart if you so much as scratched your paint.
I wouldn’t say these things to you if I didn’t mean them, Vespucci.
So sweet! You’ll be bad for my health at this rate... I feel like I’m indulging!

Fields.MenuText: Indulging is just another word for fun, Vespucci. I see more sweets in our future.
Would you feel less bad indulging if perhaps more joined in the fun?

Fields.DialogueText: What do you mean by that, Capitano? Is there something else other than supplies we’ll be getting?
Almost. I’ve contacted the base on Rhodes and they know we’re coming. We’ll stock up, ship off, and continue dancing. Simple as that!
But how far are we going to go around Rhodes?
If we keep up our pace we’ll be at it soon. Vespucci, if we have time tonight, do you want me to keep reading to you?
Don’t entice me like that... I’ll lose focus!
I wouldn’t dream of it. Oh! That reminds me, after we’re done with "A Midsummer Night’s Dream" I have another book for us.
It’s called "The Thief of Baghdad." It’s not a philosophy book, but I know you love stories.
That I do! ...And I love showing these sea hags their place. There’s a few ahead!
Would you like me to teach you the Lindy Hop? It’s an American-style dance, but I think it’ll help us out big here.
Is it as complex as the tango?
No, no. It’s more of a dance about having fun.
...Please tell me about it, Capitano.
@BATTLE
The plan worked like a charm. Goodbye, Rhodes. Hello supplies and some much needed relaxation.
Indeed! I feel much more relaxed now...
Hmph. I wish it wasn’t storming so that we could enjoy ourselves outside more.
The meteorologists said it was going to be a big one.
I understand! It’s just that I... I miss seeing the stars and I want to see the sun rise in the morning with you...

Fields.MenuText: We call that "yearning," Vespucci. And I think I’m yearning for it, too.
When this whole thing’s done, I promise we’ll go do both those things.
For now, imagine the stars above us and the sun to your right.

Fields.DialogueText: Yearning? Is that like moaning? Hm... Where would the stars be?
Really?! Where would we go?
Well... at least we're together for it.
It's only for now. Eventually, though...
Let’s go stargazing around Sardinia. While we’re there we can pick up that sorbet I was talking about!
I’m looking forward to it, Capitano. It feels amazing to be in good spirits again.
You’re getting it now, Vespucci. Have fun with it! Adventure is never black and white, feel free to paint with more colors!
Your cheerfulness is infectious, Capitano! ...I didn’t know you did art?

Fields.MenuText: I'll have to show you my sketchbook sometime.
I haven’t in a long time.
I'm not. It's just a metaphor.

Fields.DialogueText: You should! Painting helps free the mind.
You should start! Painting helps free the mind.
Capitano! That... twinkle in your eye...
Seriously, I'm not surprised you didn't know. I don't make a lot of time for it these days.
Does it, now? Hmm... I think I’d like my mind to be free of these Morganas.
Accursed... looks like they found their way through the rocks.
Soderini, it appears they’re out in a trifecta formation... What do you think we should do?
(*eyes looking around*) Sss... Ss... (*dancing about*)
Soderini is asking if there are any dances that involve spinning? We may be able to cause the Morgana to go in circles.
Oh, baby. We’re going to learn flamenco tonight...
@BATTLE
Odd, it hasn’t devolved into a rainstorm yet tonight.
I was just about to say: it’s rather quiet. Do you think we’ve finally hit the eye?
I cannot see the stars... What should I think about? I’ve already finished "A Midsummer Night’s Dream."

Fields.MenuText: Tonight’s a night for some good, old-fashioned cards, if you ask me.
If you wouldn’t mind, I’d rather spend the night just talking to you until I fall asleep.
We could always get caught up on paperwork.

Fields.DialogueText: Capitano, please. Be serious.
But we already tried tarot earlier. And our fortunes were the same...
What would you like to talk to me about, Capitano?
You know, Vespucci, I’ve got a question. Why do you love exploring so much? What makes you go out and get things?
Truthfully, it is that... sheer wonder of going somewhere that you’ve never known, meeting new people, learning new things, and seeing parts of the world others could only dream about.
But most of all: sharing these experiences with someone, showing them the ways of the world while also learning from them, and spending time with someone you care about. What about you, Capitano?
I do my best and try to protect everyone. ...But I’ve got to confess - ever since I became your Capitano, my life’s gone from boring, stagnant, and occasionally goofy to a dream.
This dream of going along together with someone, fighting as a team, learning about the world, and seeing life for what it is while opening your heart... I never thought I’d feel this way.
Capitano...
Vespucci...
... Midnight hour...
Learn to read the room-
- you insufferable sea hag!
(*a shared look*)
@BATTLE
We’re about to have a party and a half! They’ve caught up with us!
You sure we don’t have time for one more cup of tea? You really make it the best way, Vespucci. Mmm, extra honey...
W-why would you bring that up at a time like this!? The Morganas are coming for us! They’ve figured out we’re leading them on!
I don’t think this is the time for you to get flustered over honey again, Vespucci.
Don’t be coy, Capitano! Agh! They’re getting close - your orders?!
Put on your good dancing shoes, Vespucci.
Annoying fly..!
The pot calling the kettle black... Begone! (*SLASH*)
Yuyu...
Capitano, how close are we to the sweets?!

Fields.MenuText: Come on, Vespucci, aren’t you enjoying yourself?
"And this weak and idle theme."
Sorry. Just a little bit further.

Fields.DialogueText: I am, but I don’t want to overindulge! That leads to mistakes!
"No more yielding, but a dream." Just what are you planning, Capitano?
Just a few more knots... And...
CAPIIIIIIIIIIIIIII...
Can’t you see we're moving along steadily here? Vespucci, if you’d please.
You’re uninvited! We’re about to have some fun and you’re out here ruining it!
Show them the door, Vespucci!
@BATTLE
Capitano, just one-
*BOOM*
What was that?!
Well, I did say we were going to have guests.
What are you talking about? Moments ago, a brilliant shell hit a Morgana in the face! We don’t have mortars, do we?
We don’t, but our friends do. Say hello to the Rhodes Island Defense Force. They’re set up at Kritinia Castle, and we’ve just entered their range.
Capitano..! Ah! Look there, that Morgana’s huge!
It’s almost party time, Vespucci. Get ready to meet our guest of honor.
She’s a whale of a Morgana! ...Is this it?

Fields.MenuText: Hell of an adventure this has been...
Time to give it all we’ve got!
I’ve asked it so many times before. But, may I please have this dance?

Fields.DialogueText: I’ll make sure it doesn’t end on a sour note!
I can already taste that sorbet!
Shut up and take my hand, Capitano. I expect you to show me a good time.
Full-speed ahead! We’re going to breeze right through her!
Useless... Useless... Your attacks are meaningless, turn back..! Ves... pu... cci... ...Cap... i... tano...
Who gave you the right to speak our names? And where is your salute?!
Capitano, what shall we do?
We’ve got her right where we want her.
Capitano?
Take a bow. The show’s over.
*BOOM*
AguaaaahAAAAAHA!?!?
W-what? A direct hit from the mortar above! Capitano... you are magnificent...!
It's not over yet. Because-
Now we'll finish it!
@BATTLE
Questo è! (*SLASH* *CRACK* *BOOM, BOOM, BOOM*)
*INTENSE HISSING*
*Whiiiiiiiiistle*
Ves... pu... cci... Ca... pi... tano... This is the end...
*BLAUUUSHOOOOOOM!!!*
Capitano! You’ve done it! The last of the Morganas... they’re retreating!
*RAUCOUS CHEER*
Vespucci, you were absolutely beautiful....
Capitano... Capitano..!
(*excited crawling*) (*licking Captain*)
Ah, hey! Soderini! Cut that out! S-Seriously, that tickles!
Capitano... I know we’ve been in a "party" this whole time. But, what if we celebrate with a real party?
Ah, what the hell? Okay, everyone! Let’s throw a big bash right here, right now!
*CHEER*
Sardinia... I’ve missed this a lot. I feel guilty about leaving Rhodes just as we got to it - but reinforcements are inboad and they know how to defend appropriately against the Morgana now.
Si! And it’s all thanks to you, Capitano.

Fields.MenuText: Give yourself some credit, Vespucci.
It takes two to tango, Vespucci.
I appreciate the flattery, but I was hardly in this alone.

Fields.DialogueText: I did help out a bit... but you were the one to pull yourself back up from the brink!
I did help out a bit... but you were the one to pull yourself back up from the brink!
Capitano, I think I’ve learnt so much about dancing this adventure that I might be dizzy...
That dance last night under the stars... I don’t think I’ll forget it any time soon. You were awfully close, Vespucci.
T-the flamenco requires you to be close to your partner! I was simply following your lead and doing the best I could.
(*happy clicks*) Ssss.... Sss...
How dare you, Soderini!? Don’t just go saying things like that in front of the Capitano! Mind your manners!
I think I get the gist of what he said. Thank you, Soderini.
(*happy clicking*)
Grr... Hm? Oh, the sorbet? Finally! Bring it here, Capitano!
Ammazza! It’s so delicious! Like resting on top of a cloud and watching a comet go by! What are they using for flavoring, Capitano?
Funny you should ask that. It’s honey with pecans and vanilla.
(*blush*) C-Capitano... please don’t use that word with me...
Why? What’s the problem, Vespucci? Have you got a little case of the jitters?
Don’t play coy with me, Capitano... You know how it makes me feel, and you should feel ashamed for playing this game with me.
Why feel shameful when I’m with someone I like? You shouldn’t feel ashamed either, Vespucci. It’s all about having fun. (*clink*) Oh, damn it. I dropped my spoon! Let me just...
(*Vespucci grasps the Captain’s hand as it moves toward the spoon...*)
Vespucci?
Capitano... The sunrise is beautiful... Would you like to share some sorbet?
Why, Vespucci... I thought you’d never ask.
Such a lovely day this is.
I haven’t seen the sun this golden since we first left for the Levant! Ah, such good times...
We’ve made a lot of good times on this trip, Vespucci. I dare say this was a better adventure than the last one.
You taught me how to dance... that was my favorite part.
Capitano? There to port...
I see them. Let's not give them a chance to ruin our day, okay?
@BATTLE
And you showed me that you should never be afraid to go for your ambition, no matter how someone reacts.
*playful slap*

Fields.MenuText: Owww... Vespucci, that stings.
You're also teaching me I need to learn how to duck.
Thank you, ma'am. May I have another?

Fields.DialogueText: You deserved it, Capitano... Hmph!
Guilty as charged!
Hm, it’s almost noon. We should probably set sail...
*grasps the Captain’s arm tightly*
What is it, Vespucci? Did you accidentally get some...?
Capitano, I know we’ve made a lot of memories on this trip, but...
Would you mind granting me another wish?
Of course, Vespucci. Name it, and I’ll do my best to make it happen.
Can we stay here together a little while longer? I don’t want this dream to end...
You know what the best dreams are, Vespucci?
What, Capitano?
The ones where I’m with you.
Capitano...
